meta.content: Pinnacle Classical Academy is a public charter school, whose goal is to develop caring, productive citizens who exemplify ethical values throughout their daily lives. Integrated into all aspects of the academic curriculum will be the accepted patterns for developing lifelong learners and globally competitive students.

div.span: As our April 10-17 spring break draws near, I wanted to thank you for the continued partnership in our students' education during this very challenging time of remote learning. Our teachers, too, have been so moved by the ways in which so many parents and students have offered encouragement and support. As I mentioned on Facebook earlier this week, "Our parents and students are awesome!"

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
div.span: The way in which we instruct our students has changed, and I am so grateful for the ways our families have embraced that change. At the same time, our commitment to offer a premiere K-12 college-preparatory education hasn't changed, and that commitment will remain unchanged through the last day of the school year and beyond.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
div.span: During the past few weeks, we have been in frequent contact with various offices of the Department of Public Instruction. Members of our administrative team received the most recent statewide academic policy guidance earlier today.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
div.span: If you have a son or daughter in grade 12, we have made you aware of the state's new policies for seniors across the state. As we follow those policies, our commitment to prepare our seniors for college remains unchanged, and seniors are still receiving weekly assignments. And we are so proud of our seniors' hard work over the years: to date, they have been offered a cumulative $3,409,368 in four-year academic merit scholarships and athletic scholarships! Parents, if you have any questions about college admissions, financial aid, or similar questions, we encourage you to reach out to Dr. Martin at cmartin@pinnacleclassicalacademy.com.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
div.span: In recent weeks, it has become clear to us that grading for K-11 student work assigned after remote learning began has the potential to be treated very differently on a statewide level from work assigned on or before March 13. Although we have received provisional guidance on the grading of K-11 assignments since remote learning began, the State Board of Education has also made clear this guidance will in all likelihood change if public schools do not reopen for face-to-face learning after May 15.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
div.span: With no definitive guidance currently available for K-11 work assigned after remote learning began, we have decided to make March 13 the final day of the third quarter so that we can issue report cards. Third-quarter report cards will be sent home with packets on Monday, April 27.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
div.span: Teachers are keeping track of grades for assignments given since remote learning began. As we await definitive guidance from the state, we have asked teachers not to enter these grades in PowerSchool for the time being.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;
div.span: In addition, we have received some statewide guidance on GPA changes, and we have been told that further statewide guidance related to GPAs and PowerSchool is expected by the end of the month. (In a change from guidance given to charter schools several years ago, we've been informed as a charter school that uses PowerSchool that the state's 10-point grading scale should be used for generating transcripts.) Please contact Mrs. Brooks at abrooks@pinnacleclassicalacademy.com if you have any questions if you should have any questions related to high school, including questions about grading.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

div.span: Thank you again for all of your support during recent weeks as we continue our commitment to provide the best education to our students. To all of our students and their families, our best wishes for a good and restful spring break!

b.span: Pinnacle Classical Academy ranks in top 10% in state in ACT scores

p.span: Pinnacle Classical Academy ranks in the top 10% of the state's public school systems in average ACT composite scores, according to the North Carolina ACT Report, which has been released by the Department of Public Instruction.

The ACT, a leading national standardized test for college admissions, was administered in early 2019 to juniors in the state's 115 local education agencies and in 71 charter schools with juniors. Pinnacle Classical Academy's mean composite score of 21.4 ranks 17th among these 186 public school systems and was significantly higher than the state average of 18.4.

In addition, Pinnacle Classical Academy's average ACT reading score of 24.8 ranked sixth in the state, behind Raleigh Charter High School, Woods Charter School (Chapel Hill), Research Triangle High School (Durham), Chapel Hill - Carborro City Schools, and Millennium Charter Academy (Mount Airy).
Congratulations to the Pi rho Eagles FTC robotics team, which came in second of the 20 competitors in their tournament in Elon on January 5!
